text: Jason Andersen (born September 3, 1977 as Jason Young) is a former American football center who played for four seasons with the New England Patriots National Football League (NFL). He played college football at BYU. He has also played for the Kansas City Chiefs. ==Early years== Andersen attended Piedmont Hills High School in San Jose, California. In High School he lettered in football, basketball, and track. In football he was a two-time all-league and all-county selection as an offensive and defensive tackle and long snapper. In basketball he was a two-time all-league center. Andersen was recruited to play for BYU.http://byuinsider.com/football/jason-andersen/ ==College career== After graduating from high school, Andersen attended BYU, where he played multiple positions on the offensive line. In his sophomore and junior season, he played mainly right guard, with some games as right tackle. In his senior season, he played as center.http://byuinsider.com/football/jason-andersen/ ==Professional career== Andersen played for New England Patriots and Kansas City Chiefs, while being signed with the Miami Dolphins and Cleveland Browns. He also played 3 seasons in the Arena football League, playing for the Arizona Rattlers, San Jose Sabercats, and Utah Blaze.http://byuinsider.com/football/jason-andersen/https://www.pro-football- reference.com/players/A/AndeJa20.htmhttp://www.nfl.com/player/jasonandersen/2499415/profilehttps://www.espn.com/nfl/player/_/id/1592/jason- andersenhttps://www.cbssports.com/nfl/players/playerpage/12186/jason-andersen ==References== Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:People from Hayward, California Category:Players of American football from California Category:Sportspeople from Los Angeles County, California Category:American football centers Category:American football offensive guards Category:BYU Cougars football players Category:New England Patriots players Category:Kansas City Chiefs players
title: Jason Andersen
